Triangle $ABC$ has vertices at $A(5,8)$, $B(3,-2)$, and $C(6,1)$. The point $D$ with coordinates $(m,n)$ is chosen inside the triangle so that the three small triangles $ABD$, $ACD$ and $BCD$ all have equal areas. What is the value of $10m + n$?
inference:
Let the area of each of the three smaller triangles be $A$.  The area of $\triangle ABC$ is $3A$.  Using the formula $\frac{1}{2} \cdot \text{base} \cdot \text{height}$ for the area of a triangle, we have:

\[A = \frac{1}{2} \cdot \text{base}_{BD} \cdot \text{height}_{D\text{ to }AB}\]

\[A = \frac{1}{2} \cdot \text{base}_{CD} \cdot \text{height}_{D\text{ to }AC}\]

\[A = \frac{1}{2} \cdot \text{base}_{AD} \cdot \text{height}_{D\text{ to }BC}\]

Since these areas are equal, the three heights are all equal.  This means $D$ lies on the line parallel to $AB$, $AC$, and $BC$ that passes through the centroid of $\triangle ABC$.

The centroid of a triangle is the point that is $\frac{1}{3}$ of the way from each vertex to the midpoint of the opposite side.  The midpoint of $\overline{BC}$ is $\left(\frac{3+6}{2}, \frac{-2+1}{2}\right) = \left(\frac{9}{2}, -\frac{1}{2}\right)$.  The centroid is $\frac{1}{3}$ of the way from $A(5,8)$ to $\left(\frac{9}{2}, -\frac{1}{2}\right)$, so the coordinates of the centroid are

\[\left(5 + \frac{1}{3} \left(\frac{9}{2} - 5\right), 8 + \frac{1}{3} \left(-\frac{1}{2} - 8\right)\right) = \left(\frac{11}{2}, \frac{11}{2}\right).\]

The slope of $AB$ is $\frac{8-(-2)}{5-3} = 5$, so the line through the centroid parallel to $AB$ has equation $y - \frac{11}{2} = 5 \left(x - \frac{11}{2}\right)$.  Simplifying, we get $y = 5x - 22$.  Thus, $D$ is of the form $(m, 5m - 22)$, and $10m + n = 10m + (5m - 22) = \boxed{15m - 22}$.
ground_truth: If $D$ is the centroid of triangle $ABC$, then $ABD$, $ACD$, and $BCD$ would all have equal areas (to see this, remember that the medians of a triangle divide the triangle into 6 equal areas). There is only one point with this property (if we move around $D$, the area of one of the small triangles will increase and will no longer be $1/3$ of the total area). So $D$ must be the centroid of triangle $ABC$. The $x$ and $y$ coordinates of the centroid are found by averaging the $x$ and $y$ coordinates, respectively, of the vertices, so $(m,n) = \left( \frac{5+3+6}{3}, \frac{8+(-2)+1}{3} \right) = \left( \frac{14}{3}, \frac{7}{3} \right)$, and $10m + n = 10 \left(\frac{14}{3}\right) + \frac{7}{3} = \boxed{49}$.
